00017 #include "MisrFileQuery.h"
00018 #include "MisrError.h"
00019 #include <stdio.h>    /* standard input/output routines.    */
00020 #include <sys/stat.h> /* stat(), etc.                       */
00021 #include <string.h>   /* strstr(), etc.                     */
00022 
00023 #ifdef _WIN32
00024   #include "dirent_win32.h"
00025 #else
00026   #include <dirent.h>   /* readdir(), etc.                    */
00027 #endif
00028 
00029 #ifndef _WIN32
00030   #include <unistd.h>   /* getcwd(), etc.                     */
00031 #endif
00032 
00033 #include <regex.h>
00034 
00035 #ifndef S_ISDIR
00036 #define S_ISDIR(x) (((x) & S_IFMT) == S_IFDIR)
00037 #endif
00038 
00039 #ifndef REG_BASIC    /* REG_BASIC is not defined in regex.h in Linux */
00040 # define REG_BASIC 0
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 #define MAX_DIR_PATH 2048   /* maximal full path we support.      */
00044 #define FILE_LIST_SIZE 20       /* Size to extend file list by */
00045 
00046 static void findfile(const regex_t* preg, int *count, int *max, char ***file_list, MTKt_status *status);
00047 
00048 
00064 MTKt_status MtkFindFileList(
00065   const char *searchdir, 
00066   const char *product,   
00067   const char *camera,    
00068   const char *path,      
00069   const char *orbit,     
00070   const char *version,   
00071   int *filecnt,          
00072   char **filenames[]      )
00073 {
00074     MTKt_status status;   /* Return status */
00075     int status_code;
00076     char* dir_path;       /* path to the directory. */
00077     regex_t preg;
00078     char **temp_file_list = NULL;
00079     int count;
00080     int max = FILE_LIST_SIZE;
00081     char *curr_dir = NULL; /* current directory */
00082     int path_name_size = 1024; /* length of curr_dir */
00083     struct stat dir_stat; /* used by stat().        */
00084     char temp[128];
00085 
00086 
00087     /* Check Arguments */
00088     if (searchdir == NULL || product == NULL || path == NULL ||
00089         orbit == NULL || version == NULL || filecnt == NULL ||
00090         filenames == NULL)
00091       MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_NULLPTR);
00092 
00093     dir_path = (char *)searchdir;
00094 
00095     /* make sure the given path refers to a directory. */
00096     if (stat(dir_path, &dir_stat) == -1) {
00097     /* perror("stat:"); */
00098        MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_FAILURE);
00099     }
00100 
00101     if (!S_ISDIR(dir_stat.st_mode)) {
00102     /* fprintf(stderr, "'%s' is not a directory\n", dir_path); */
00103        MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_FAILURE);
00104     }
00105     
00106     /* save current directory
00107        allocate a larger buffer if needed */
00108     curr_dir = (char*)malloc(path_name_size * sizeof(char));
00109     while (getcwd(curr_dir,path_name_size) == NULL)
00110     {
00111       path_name_size += 1024;
00112       curr_dir = (char*)realloc(curr_dir,path_name_size * sizeof(char));
00113     }
00114 
00115     /* change into the given directory. */
00116     if (chdir(dir_path) == -1) {
00117     /*fprintf(stderr, "Cannot change to directory '%s': ", dir_path);
00118     perror(""); */
00119        MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_FAILURE);
00120     }
00121 
00122     /* Create regular expression */
00123     if (camera == NULL)
00124       sprintf(temp,"MISR_AM1_%s_P%s_O%s_%s.hdf",product,path,
00125               orbit,version);
00126     else if (strlen(camera) == 0)
00127       sprintf(temp,"MISR_AM1_%s_P%s_O%s_%s.hdf",product,path,
00128               orbit,version);
00129     else
00130       sprintf(temp,"MISR_AM1_%s_P%s_O%s_%s_%s.hdf",product,path,
00131               orbit,camera,version);
00132 
00133     regcomp(&preg,temp,REG_BASIC | REG_NOSUB);
00134 
00135     /* Allocated memory */
00136     max = FILE_LIST_SIZE;
00137     temp_file_list = (char**)calloc(max,sizeof(int*));
00138     count = 0;
00139 
00140     /* recursively scan the directory for the given file name pattern. */
00141     status = MTK_SUCCESS;
00142     findfile(&preg,&count,&max,&temp_file_list,&status);
00143 
00144     *filecnt = count;
00145     *filenames = temp_file_list;
00146 
00147     /* restore current directory */
00148     chdir(curr_dir);
00149 
00150     regfree(&preg);
00151     free(curr_dir);
00152 
00153     return MTK_SUCCESS;
00154 
00155 ERROR_HANDLE:
00156   if (temp_file_list != NULL)
00157     MtkStringListFree(max, &temp_file_list);
00158 
00159   if (curr_dir != NULL)
00160   {
00161     chdir(curr_dir); /* restore current directory */
00162     free(curr_dir);
00163   }
00164 
00165   return status_code;
00166 }
00167 
00168 
00169 static void findfile(const regex_t* preg, int *count, int *max, char ***file_list, MTKt_status *status)
00170 {
00171     DIR* dir;           /* pointer to the scanned directory. */
00172     struct dirent* entry;   /* pointer to one directory entry.   */
00173     char cwd[MAX_DIR_PATH+1];   /* current working directory.        */
00174     struct stat dir_stat;       /* used by stat().                   */
00175     int len;
00176     char **temp_file_list;
00177     int i;
00178 
00179     /* first, save path of current working directory */
00180     if (!getcwd(cwd, MAX_DIR_PATH+1))
00181     {
00182     /*perror("getcwd:");*/
00183       return;
00184     }
00185 
00186     /* open the directory for reading */
00187     dir = opendir(".");
00188     if (!dir)
00189     {
00190     /*fprintf(stderr, "Cannot read directory '%s': ", cwd);
00191     perror("");*/
00192       return;
00193     }
00194 
00195     /* scan the directory, traversing each sub-directory, and */
00196     /* matching the pattern for each file name.               */
00197     while ((entry = readdir(dir)))
00198     {
00199       /* check if the pattern matchs. */
00200       if (entry->d_name && regexec(preg, entry->d_name, 0, NULL, 0) == 0)
00201       {
00202         len = strlen(cwd) + strlen(entry->d_name) + 2;
00203         if (*count < *max)
00204            (*file_list)[*count] = (char*)malloc(len * sizeof(char));
00205         else /* Extend List */
00206         {
00207           temp_file_list = (char**)calloc(*max + FILE_LIST_SIZE, sizeof(int*));
00208           if (temp_file_list == NULL)
00209           {
00210             /*fprintf(stderr,"Error extending memory\n");*/
00211             *status = MTK_FAILURE;
00212             return;
00213           }
00214            
00215           *max += FILE_LIST_SIZE;
00216           for (i = 0; i < *count; ++i)
00217           temp_file_list[i] = (*file_list)[i];
00218            
00219           temp_file_list[*count] = (char*)malloc(len * sizeof(char));
00220           *file_list = temp_file_list;
00221         }
00222 
00223         strcpy((*file_list)[*count],cwd);
00224         strcat((*file_list)[*count],"/");
00225         strcat((*file_list)[*count],entry->d_name);
00226         ++*count;
00227       }
00228       
00229       /* check if the given entry is a directory. */
00230       if (stat(entry->d_name, &dir_stat) == -1)
00231       {
00232         /*perror("stat:");*/
00233         continue;
00234       }
00235     
00236       /* skip the "." and ".." entries, to avoid loops. */
00237       if (strcmp(entry->d_name, ".") == 0)
00238         continue;
00239       
00240       if (strcmp(entry->d_name, "..") == 0)
00241         continue;
00242       
00243       /* is this a directory? */
00244       if (S_ISDIR(dir_stat.st_mode))
00245       {
00246         /* Change into the new directory */
00247         if (chdir(entry->d_name) == -1)
00248         {
00249           /*fprintf(stderr, "Cannot chdir into '%s': ", entry->d_name);
00250             perror("");*/
00251           continue;
00252         }
00253         /* check this directory */
00254         findfile(preg,count,max,file_list,status);
00255 
00256         /* finally, restore the original working directory. */
00257         if (chdir("..") == -1)
00258         {
00259             /*fprintf(stderr, "Cannot chdir back to '%s': ", cwd);
00260             perror("");*/
00261           return;
00262         }
00263       }
00264     }
00265     
00266     closedir(dir);
00267 }
